result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Lawrenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 15CM2560 and 15CM2520. Huber for work, job search, medical treatment and any counseling.
Probation is concurrent with probation in 15CM2560 and 15CM2520.

miscConds.notes:
- provide a DNA sample
Court holds open restitution.  Court does not impose a fine.
Court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges on 15CM1898, 15CM2560 and 15CM2520 at $50/month commencing 3/1/2016 and on the 1st of each month until paid in full.  Any missed payment and the total becomes due and owing immediately to convert to a civil judgment with tax intercept.
- obtain a GED.  Defendant to be enrolled in a GED program by 2-16-2016
- no contact with victim, the retail store named in the complaint
- establish paternity of his child residing in Colorado

- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- no use of alcohol or drugs
- random urine screens

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David W Lawrenz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David W Lawrenz in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 18 days time served.  Court orders Huber privileges for work, job search, medical treatment and any counseling.  This sentence to run concurrent with 15CM2560 and 15CM2520.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.  Probation is concurrent with probation in 15CM2560 and 15CM2520.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- no use of alcohol or drugs
- random urine screens
- no contact with victim, the retail store named in the complaint
- establish paternity of his child residing in Colorado
- obtain a GED.  Defendant to be enrolled in a GED program by 2-16-2016
- provide a DNA sample
Court holds open restitution.  Court does not impose a fine.
Court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges on 15CM1898, 15CM2560 and 15CM2520 at $50/month commencing 3/1/2016 and on the 1st of each month until paid in full.  Any missed payment and the total becomes due and owing immediately to convert to a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.
Justice Point Program report dated February 1, 2016; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed drug test/positive drug test.

Defendant David W Lawrenz in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Mayfair Mall

Defendant David W Lawrenz in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant David W Lawrenz in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
from JusticePoint:  Discharge Summary.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court on August 20, 2015.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear on August 20, 2015, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant David W Lawrenz not in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case called to address JusticePoint violation (new cases).  State is not requesting bail be modified.  No action taken this date.  Case remains calendared for final pretrial on August 20, 2015 at 8:30 am and for jury trial on September 9, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.
Clerk contacted attorney Araiza to schedule matter for a bail/bond hearing on August 7, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24 to address the JusticePoint violation.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - new charges filed (2 cases).
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed - missed office contact, missed drug test and positive drug test.

Defendant David W Lawrenz in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Defense counsel requests jury trial date. Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Mayfair Mall.

Defendant David W Lawrenz in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant David W Lawrenz in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
